It means that the slander comes in gradually, not letting people be aware of it in advance.
Even Zai Dan, who was extremely filial,
his mother would still suspect him of killing people.
The market is not a forest,
people would still suspect there are tigers.
There are some who do not go there,
and they are called the wise and far-sighted gentlemen.
I am foolish, clumsy, and lazy, and do not like flattery or falsely pleasing others, so I have often been slandered by others.
When I hear it, I secretly reflect on myself and say:
Is what they say really true?
I will correct my mistakes.
He is my teacher.
Are his words really wrong?
He is just a follower.
How can he taint me?
Thus, although I hear it, my mouth has never spoken.
The gentlemen and virtuous ones discern whether to investigate or not based on their talent and knowledge.
Who am I to try to explain right and wrong and seek understanding from others?
However, I do not know if it will be clear after a long time,
or if it will be clear in later generations,
or if it will never be clear throughout ancient times.
Wen Zhongzi said:
How can one stop slander by not speaking?
I will follow this advice.
Lazy Ancestor Chu, the abbot, said:

It is the root of birth and death.
Where emotional views are exhausted, one must investigate the reason for their exhaustion.
